data.title: Usher - Songs, Events and Music Stats
data.meta_description: Usher: Listen to new and popular songs, find events, look into their stats and see who their fans are.
data.text:
Usher is a well-known R&B and Contemporary R&B musician from Chattanooga, Tennessee, who is noted for his deep vocals and graceful dancing. Usher has spent more than three decades working in the music business. He has won multiple Grammy awards and sold millions of CDs globally.

Usher is known for his unusual vocal style and his flawless fusion of R&B, pop, and hip-hop in his music. His songs frequently deal with themes of love, heartbreak, and human development. From his early R&B singles like "U Remind Me" and "Yeah!" to more recent songs like "No Limit" and "Don't Waste My Time," which have a more modern vibe, Usher's music has developed throughout time.

Unquestionably, Usher has had a significant impact on the R&B genre, and this influence can be observed in the work of many other artists who have followed in his footsteps. Usher has established himself as a true music business legend thanks to his silky vocals, charismatic stage presence, and catchy dance moves.

Usher is a well-known R&B and modern R&B performer from Chattanooga, Tennessee, in the United States. He has a sizable fan base thanks to the several popular songs he has made. The songs "Yeah!" (featuring Lil Jon and Ludacris), "DJ Got Us Fallin' in Love," "New Flame" (featuring Usher and Rick Ross), "Without You" (featuring Usher), "My Boo," "I Don't Mind" (featuring Juicy J), "Promise" (featuring Usher) - English Version," "Party" (featuring Usher & Gucci Mane), "

Usher has a lot of hit songs, one of them being "Yeah! (feat. Lil Jon & Ludacris)". In numerous nations after its release in 2004, it topped the charts and became a club favorite. Another well-liked song is Pitbull's "DJ Got Us Fallin' in Love." Usher received several accolades for this song, which was commercially successful when it was released in 2010.

Usher's music is a fantastic blend of traditional R&B and modern R&B, and his songs are renowned for having catchy beats and deep lyrics. His fame has also been boosted by his partnerships with other musicians, and he has done so with a number of well-known figures in the music business. Usher has solidified his position as one of the most well-known R&B performers of our time by regularly churning out hit songs.

Usher is a well-known R&B and modern R&B artist from Chattanooga, Tennessee, who has been putting out music for more than 20 years. His most recent album, "My Way (25th Anniversary Edition) (2022)," includes previously unreleased songs in addition to remastered versions of his beloved 1997 album "My Way." For Usher fans, the CD is a sentimental trip down memory lane that shows the artist's development and maturation throughout time.

The artist's most recent single, "GLU (2023)," which was published in January 2023, is a sensual and soulful number that emphasizes his distinctively soft vocals. Usher's signature romantic lyrics and melodic melodies are featured in the song, which is a love letter to a significant person. His remixes of Justin Bieber's "Peaches" and "Too Much (feat. Imanbek & Usher) [Alle Farben Remix]," which had throbbing electronic beats, were hits in 2021. This song is the follow-up to both.

"Hard II Love," Usher's 2016 album, demonstrated the musician's flexibility as he dabbled with many genres, such as dance-pop and trap. His 2018 album "A," which he co-produced with Zaytoven, included trap sounds and Usher's mellow vocals. Overall, Usher has cemented his reputation as one of the greatest R&B performers of all time with his music, which continues to enthrall audiences with his soulful voice and meaningful lyrics.

The American singer and songwriter Usher, who hails from Chattanooga, has performed on some of the largest platforms in the music business. One Musicfest, Dreamville Festival, Something In The Water, and Lovers and Friends Festival are just a few of the major festivals he has performed at. Usher typically gives electrifying performances that leave the audience in amazement at these events, which have drawn thousands of fans from around the globe.

Usher has played in some of the most renowned locations in the world in addition to festivals. The Colosseum at Caesars Palace, Park Theater, La Seine Musicale, Staatsoper, and Marvel Stadium are among them. Although each of these locations has an own atmosphere, Usher's performance is always the night's high point.

At the 2010 MTV Video Music Awards, he gave one of his most memorable performances, singing a medley of his big songs, including "OMG" and "DJ Got Us Fallin' in Love." Usher's dance skills astounded the crowd, and the performance was highly received. Another standout performance was his duet with Chris Brown and Trey Songz at the 2014 iHeartRadio Music Festival.

Overall, Usher has continually displayed his talent and showmanship during his performances. In addition to his admirers and music enthusiasts alike, he has performed at some of the greatest festivals and venues in the globe.

A number of artists have worked with Usher to produce some of his most well-known songs. One of his best-known collaborations is "Yeah!" with Lil Jon and Ludacris. The trio's connection was unmistakable, and the song's captivating beat and lyrics helped it become a chart-topper. Pitbull and Usher also collaborated on the club hit "DJ Got Us Fallin' in Love," which they released. Usher's mellow voice and Pitbull's upbeat rhymes made for the ideal duo.

With Chris Brown and Rick Ross, there was another noteworthy cooperation for "New Flame." The song became a fan favorite due to its seductive melody and the vocals of the trio. On "Without You," which peaked at number one on the charts, Usher also collaborated with David Guetta. An amazing song was created by Guetta's electronic beats and Usher's soulful voice.

Not to be overlooked is the duet on "My Boo" with Alicia Keys. The song became a classic R&B success because to the duo's vocals and its beautiful melody. The distinctive tones and simpatico between the musicians have been acknowledged throughout Usher's collaborations. Overall, his partnerships have increased his success in the music business, and his future partnerships are highly anticipated by fans.

What was Usher's first hit?

"The single "Think of You" from Usher's self-titled debut album became his first hit in 1994 and helped him achieve gold status."

Why is Usher so rich?

Worldwide, he has sold millions of copies, bringing in millions for himself. Confessions, his debut album, sold more than 10 million copies to earn Diamond certification. Usher has made millions of dollars via streaming, downloads, and music publishing royalties in addition to record sales.

How many kids does Usher have?

Usher is a dad of 4 children.

What age is Usher?

44 years (October 14, 1978)

What was Usher's biggest hit?

Usher's biggest hit to date is "Yeah!," which was the first song from Confessions and spent 12 weeks at the top of the Billboard Hot 100 list while selling over four million copies.

How many #1 hit songs does Usher have?

Usher has nine Billboard Hot 100 number-one singles and 18 Hot 100 top-ten singles.

How much did Usher make off of Justin Bieber?

HarbourView recently paid an estimated $40 million for the R&B superstar's shares in RBMG, the record company that signed Justin Bieber in 2008.

Did Usher teach Justin Bieber?

After Justin Bieber signed his recording contract, Usher served as his mentor, offering advice in addition to that from his manager.

When did Usher fire his mom?

Usher fired his mom as his manager in 2007 and then again after she rejoined his team in 2008.

How old was Justin Bieber when he sang for Usher?

At age 13, Justin Bieber sang for Usher.

How old was Justin Bieber when he met Usher?

At the age of 15, Justin Bieber met Usher.

Why is Usher so famous?

Usher became one of the most popular R&B singers of his generation and one of the best-selling musicians in American history thanks to his award-winning music career as a singer, songwriter, and actor.

How much money is Usher worth?

Usher is worth around $190 million.

Why is Usher worth so much?

Music. Usher's music is his main source of income. He is a singer and songwriter who has made millions of dollars from the singles he has released.

Who had a baby with Usher?

Usher had a baby with his girlfriend Jenn Goicoechea named Sire Castrello Raymond.

Did Usher find Justin Bieber?

After Justin Bieber's YouTube videos started becoming big in 2008, Usher first met him and later became his mentor.

How much did Usher make on Justin Bieber?

The R&B icon received almost $40 million through the purchase of his shares in RBMG, the record company that signed Justin Bieber in 2008.

Did Usher marry his manager?

In 2015, Usher secretly wed Miguel, his longtime partner and manager. He previously wed Tameka Foster, with whom he has two sons, and this was their second union.

How long has Usher been with Jennifer?

Usher and Jennifer have been together since 2019, when they started dating in October of that year.

What happened to Usher and his wife?

Usher and Grace Miguel's second marriage ended more than two years ago, and since then, he has moved on with his girlfriend and their daughter, who was born in September 2020.

Why did Usher get custody of the kids?

Usher was given primary custody during the last custody dispute because it was ruled that having them reside with him most of the time was in their best interests.

Did Usher ever marry?

Tameka Foster married Usher for two years.

How did Usher meet his wife?

Given that both Usher and his wife have worked in the music industry for some time, the most likely method they met is through common friends or acquaintances.

Are Usher and Justin Bieber still friends?

Usher and Justin Bieber have worked together on numerous tracks over the years and are still close friends. Usher sees Justin Bieber as a buddy and is glad to continue be involved in his business.

Was Usher invited to Justin Bieber's wedding?

Celebrities including Usher performed music and beatboxing during the couple's wedding in South Carolina as they cut their wedding cake.
